sen.j: 友禅（ゆうぜん）とは、布に模様を染める技法のひとつ。
sen.e: Yuzen is one of techniques to dye a cloth with patterns on it.
Yuzen is a techniques to dye cloth with patterns on it.
Yuzen is a technique to dye cloth with patterns on it.

sen.j: 本来でんぷん質（米製）の防染剤を用いる手書きの染色を友禅と呼ぶが、現在は型染めや友禅を模した模様をプリントしたものも友禅と言う名称で販売されていることが多い。
sen.e: A hand-drawn dyeing using a resisting agent made from starch (rice) was originally called yuzen, but now clothes dyed with models or printed with a pattern modeling yuzen are often sold under a name of yuzen.

A hand-drawn dyeing using a resisting agent made from starch (rice) was originally called yuzen, but now clothes dyed with models or printed with a pattern modeling yuzen are often sold under the name of yuzen.

A hand-drawn dyeing using a resisting agent made from starch (rice) was originally called yuzen, but now clothes dyed with models or printed with a pattern modeling yuzen are often sold under the name of yuzen.

sen.j: 日本の最も代表的な染色法である。
sen.e: It is the most representative dyeing technique.
It is the most representative dyeing technique.
It is the most representative dyeing technique in Japan.

sen.j: 名称は創始者である江戸時代の扇絵師・宮崎友禅斎から名づけられたといわれる。
sen.e: The name was allegedly taken after Yuzensai MIYAZAKI, a painter of folding fan in Edo period who was the founder.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The name was allegedly taken after Yuzensai MIYAZAKI, a painter of folding fans in the Edo period who was the founder.
The name was allegedly taken after Yuzensai MIYAZAKI, a painter of folding fans in the Edo period who was the founder.

sen.j: 彼の創始した京友禅の技法を本人が加賀藩（現在の石川県）の城下町金沢に持ち込んで独自の発展を遂げたものを加賀友禅という。
sen.e: He brought the technique of Kyo-Yuzen that he started into Kanazawa, the castle town of Kaga Domain (present Ishikawa Prefecture) and the technique was developed into a unique style, which is called Kaga-Yuzen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He brought the technique of Kyo-Yuzen that he started into Kanazawa, the castle town of Kaga Domain (present Ishikawa Prefecture), and the technique was developed into a unique style, which is called Kaga-Yuzen.

He brought the technique of Kyo-Yuzen that he started into Kanazawa, the castle town of Kaga Domain (present Ishikawa Prefecture), and the technique was developed into a unique style, which is called Kaga-Yuzen.

sen.j: 明治時代には、広瀬治助が捺染の技法を用いた「型紙友禅」を考案し、友禅染の裾野を広げた。
sen.e: In Meiji Period, Jisuke HIROSE invented 'Katagami Yuzen' (Yuzen-style printed silk using cutting paper patterns) employing a printing technique, which broadened the popularity of yuzen.
In Meiji Period, Jisuke HIROSE invented 'Katagami Yuzen' (Yuzen-style printed silk using cutting paper patterns) employing a printing technique, which broadened the popularity of yuzen.
In Meiji Period, Jisuke HIROSE invented 'Katagami Yuzen' (Yuzen-style printed silk using cutting paper patterns) employing a printing technique, which broadened the popularity of yuzen.

sen.j: 一つの布の面に世界の染色の中でも類を見ないほどの多彩な色彩を使い、「友禅模様」と呼ばれる曲線的で簡略化された動植物、器物、風景などの文様を描き出すのが特徴。
sen.e: Yuzen is characterized in drawing patterns of rounded and simplified animals, plants, utensils, and landscapes, which are called 'yuzen pattern,' using as many colors on a single plane of a cloth as never seen in any dyeing techniques in the world.

Yuzen is characterized by drawing patterns of rounded and simplified animals, plants, utensils, and landscapes, which are called 'yuzen pattern,' using as many colors on a single plane of a cloth as never seen in any dyeing techniques in the world.

Yuzen is characterized by drawing patterns of rounded and simplified animals, plants, utensils, and landscapes, which are called 'yuzen pattern,' using as many colors on a single plane of a cloth as never seen in any dyeing techniques in the world.

sen.j: 考案者が絵師であったこともあって、当時は日本画の顔料として使われる青黛や艶紅などを柄の彩色に使用した。
sen.e: Because the inventor was the painter, seitai (a blue pigment used for Japanese painting) and hikari-beni, also referred to as tsuya-beni (a red pigment made from safflowers), used for Japanese painting were used to color the patterns.

Because the inventor was a painter, seitai (a blue pigment used for Japanese painting) and hikari-beni, also referred to as tsuya-beni (a red pigment made from safflowers), used for Japanese painting were used to color the patterns.

Because the inventor was a painter, seitai (a blue pigment used for Japanese painting) and hikari-beni, also referred to as tsuya-beni (a red pigment made from safflowers), used for Japanese painting were used to color the patterns.

sen.j: 1856年に発見された化学染料の発達によって模様の彩色は多岐に発達した。
sen.e: Due to the development of a chemical dye found in 1856, the coloring of the patterns were developed into various ways.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to the development of a chemical dye found in 1856, the coloring of the patterns were developed into numerous variations.
Due to the development of a chemical dye found in 1856, the coloring of the patterns were developed into numerous variations.

sen.j: 普通は単独で十分に衣装を装飾するが振袖などの特に晴れがましい衣装の場合は鹿の子絞りや刺繍、金彩などを併用することもある。
sen.e: It generally decorates costumes sufficiently on its own, but sometimes it is combined with tie-dyeing technique with a pattern of minute rings, embroidery, and kinsai (gold dyeing) for especially gorgeous costumes such as furisode (a long sleeved type of kimono).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It generally decorates costumes sufficiently on its own, but sometimes it is combined with a tie-dyeing technique using a pattern of tiny rings, embroidery, and kinsai (gold dyeing) for especially gorgeous costumes such as furisode (a long sleeved type of kimono).

It generally decorates costumes sufficiently on its own, but sometimes it is combined with a tie-dyeing technique using a pattern of tiny rings, embroidery, and kinsai (gold dyeing) for especially gorgeous costumes such as furisode (a long sleeved type of kimono).

sen.j: 本友禅とも呼ばれる本格的な手描き友禅は多くの工程によって成り立つが、作家がオリジナルの創作を行う場合と職人の分業によって製作される場合がある。
sen.e: The authentic hand-drawn yuzen, which is also referred to as 'Hon-Yuzen,' is produced through many steps, and there are cases where an artist creates an original yuzen, and where it is produced by artisans based on the division of labor.

The authentic hand-drawn yuzen, which is also referred to as 'Hon-Yuzen,' is produced through many steps, and there are cases where an artist creates an original yuzen, and where it is produced by artisans based on the division of labor.

The authentic hand-drawn yuzen, which is also referred to as 'Hon-Yuzen,' is produced through many steps, and there are cases where an artist creates an original yuzen, and where it is produced by artisans based on the division of labor.

sen.j: 分業の場合、まず染め職人が工房に保管してある膨大な図案見本を参考に、下絵を書き始める。
sen.e: In the case of the division of labor, first a dyeing artisan draws a preliminary sketch with reference to a huge amount of design samples stored in the atelier.
In the case of the division of labor, first a dyeing artisan draws a preliminary sketch with reference to a huge amount of design samples stored in the workshop.
In the case of the division of labor, first a dyeing artisan draws a preliminary sketch with reference to a huge amount of design samples stored in the workshop.

sen.j: このとき染め上がりに影響しないように、水に弱いツユクサ科のオオボウシバナの花弁から抽出した色素が下絵用のインクとして使われる。
sen.e: At this time, pigments extracted from petals of oboshi-bana flower, or big cap flower (a species of Asiatic dayflower, Commelina communis var. hortensis), which is highly soluble in water, is used as ink for the preliminary sketch so as not to effect the finish.
At this time, pigments extracted from petals of oboshi-bana flower, or big cap flower, which is highly soluble in water, is used as ink for the preliminary sketch so as not to effect the finish.
At this time, pigments extracted from petals of oboshi-bana flower, or big cap flower, which is highly soluble in water, is used as ink for the preliminary sketch so as not to effect the finish.

sen.j: 次に、描かれた下絵の上から米糊やゴム糊などの防染剤で正確に輪郭線を置いていく。
sen.e: Next, contours are precisely drawn with the resisting agent such as rice glue or rubber glue over the drawn preliminary sketch.
Next, contours are precisely drawn with the resisting agent such as rice glue or rubber glue over the drawn preliminary sketch.
Next, contours are precisely drawn with the resisting agent such as rice glue or rubber glue over the drawn preliminary sketch.

sen.j: 渋紙で作られた筒などに真鍮の金具をつけ、金具の細い先で常に一定の太さの線を引くのはかなりの熟練が必要とされる作業。
sen.e: Drawing a line with a constant thickness with a tip of a metal fixture made of brass attached to a cylinder made of paper treated with astringent persimmon juice requires quite a skill.
Drawing a line with a constant thickness with a brass tip attached to a paper cylinder treated with astringent persimmon juice requires great skill.
Drawing a line with a constant thickness with a brass tip attached to a paper cylinder treated with astringent persimmon juice requires great skill.

sen.j: この線を「糸目」といい、染め上がったときに模様の輪郭に糸目状の白い線が見られ、友禅染のもっとも大きな特徴となっている。
sen.e: The line is referred to as 'itome,' and it leaves a white line along the itome in the contours of the pattern when the cloth is dyed, which is the most typical feature of yuzen.
The line is referred to as 'itome,' and it leaves a white line along the itome in the contours of the pattern when the cloth is dyed, which is the most typical feature of yuzen.
The line is referred to as 'itome,' and it leaves a white line along the itome in the contours of the pattern when the cloth is dyed, which is the most typical feature of yuzen.

sen.j: 輪郭が完成した模様に筆や刷毛で染料を染め付けていくのが「色挿し」と呼ばれる工程である。
sen.e: Applying a dye to the pattern finished with the contours using a blush is a step called 'irosashi' (literally 'applying color').
Applying a dye to the pattern finished with the contours using a brush is a step called 'irosashi' (literally 'applying color').
Applying a dye to the pattern finished with the contours using a brush is a step called 'irosashi' (literally 'applying color').

sen.j: 現在は化学染料が使われているが、かってはアイ (植物)や紅花、蘇芳、茜、紫根、刈安などの植物染料、臙脂虫などの動物染料のような天然由来の染料を用いていた。
sen.e: Although chemical dyes are used in these days, natural dyes including plant-derived dyes such as indigo, beni-bana flower (safflower), suo(dark red), akane (a madder; Rubia akane; R. cordifolia var. mungista, used for red color), shikon (lithospermum root used for purple color), and kariyasu (Miscanthus tinctorius), and animal dyes such as enji mushi (the cochineal insect) were used in the past.

Although chemical dyes are used these days, natural dyes including plant-derived dyes such as indigo, safflower, suo (dark red), akane (madder), shikon (lithospermum root used for purple color), and kariyasu (Miscanthus tinctorius), and animal dyes such as enji mushi (cochineal) were used in the past.

Although chemical dyes are used these days, natural dyes including plant-derived dyes such as indigo, safflower, suo (dark red), akane (madder), shikon (lithospermum root used for purple color), and kariyasu (Miscanthus tinctorius), and animal dyes such as enji mushi (cochineal) were used in the past.

sen.j: この工程で柄の大体の色が彩色される。
sen.e: Most colors are applied in this step.
Most colors are applied in this step.
Most colors are applied in this step.

sen.j: 一つの色を染めてしまうと色がにじんで混ざるのを防ぐために乾くまで次の色には移らない。
sen.e: Once a color is applied, next color cannot be applied until the previously used dye dries to prevent the colors from running.
Once a color is applied, the next color cannot be applied until the previously used dye dries to prevent the colors from running.
Once a color is applied, the next color cannot be applied until the previously used dye dries to prevent the colors from running.

sen.j: 「色挿し」が終わると「蒸し」という工程がある。
sen.e: After the 'irosashi,' there is another step called 'mushi' (literally 'steaming').
After the 'irosashi,' there is another step called 'mushi' (literally 'steaming').
After the 'irosashi,' there is another step called 'mushi' (literally 'steaming').

sen.j: 80℃以上の高温で20分から40分、蒸気を当てることによって生地に染料を定着させる。
sen.e: The dyes are fixed to the cloth by applying steam of 80 ℃ or higher for 20 to 40 minutes.
The dyes are fixed to the cloth by applying steam of 80 ℃ or higher for 20 to 40 minutes.
The dyes are fixed to the cloth by applying steam of 80 ℃ or higher for 20 to 40 minutes.

sen.j: 次に「地染め」といって、生地全体の地の色を染める作業に移る。
sen.e: The process moves to 'jizome' (literally 'base dyeing') to dye the whole cloth with the base color.
The process moves to 'jizome' (literally 'base dyeing') to dye the whole cloth with the base color.
The process moves to 'jizome' (literally 'base dyeing') to dye the whole cloth with the base color.

sen.j: 輪郭にも使った防染剤で丁寧に模様全体を覆った後に（「伏せ糊」）地の色の染料を染める。
sen.e: After carefully covering the entire pattern with the same resisting agent as used on the contours ('fusenori'), the cloth is dyed with the base color.
After carefully covering the entire pattern with the same resisting agent as used on the contours ('fusenori'), the cloth is dyed with the base color.
After carefully covering the entire pattern with the same resisting agent as used on the contours ('fusenori'), the cloth is dyed with the base color.

sen.j: 地染めは着物に仕立てたときに縫い合わせた左右両方の生地の色が同じになるように染めるため、熟練した染職人が行うことが多い。
sen.e: To dye the cloth so that the base color is precisely the same shade between connecting pieces when sawn into a kimono, jizome is performed by a skilled dyeing artisan.
To dye the cloth so that the base color is precisely the same shade between connecting pieces when sewn into a kimono, jizome is performed by a skilled dyeing artisan.
To dye the cloth so that the base color is precisely the same shade between connecting pieces when sewn into a kimono, jizome is performed by a skilled dyeing artisan.

sen.j: 藍などのような原料を発酵させて得る染料の場合は特に酵素の活性を高めるために高温多湿の環境で染色を行わねばならないため、作業は夏ごろ行われることが多い。
sen.e: To use a dye produced by fermenting a raw material such as the indigo, the dyeing process must be performed in a hot and humid environment so as to activate the enzyme, the work is generally done in the summer.

To use a dye produced by fermenting a raw material such as indigo, the dyeing process must be performed in a hot and humid environment so as to activate the enzyme, so the work is generally done in the summer.

To use a dye produced by fermenting a raw material such as indigo, the dyeing process must be performed in a hot and humid environment so as to activate the enzyme, so the work is generally done in the summer.

sen.j: 有名な「友禅流し」とは水のきれいな川で糊や余分な染料を落とす工程のこと。
sen.e: The famous 'Yuzen Nagashi' is a step of removing glues and extra dyes in a clean river.
The famous 'Yuzen Nagashi' is the process of removing glues and extra dyes in a clean river.
The famous 'Yuzen Nagashi' is the process of removing glues and extra dyes in a clean river.

sen.j: 染めの工程とは違って厳冬のころ行うことが多く雪国の金沢では雪解け水にさらすこともある。
sen.e: Unlike the steps of dyeing, it is generally performed in cold winter, and the cloth is often washed in melted snow water in Kanazawa located in a snowy area.
Unlike the steps of dyeing, it is generally performed in cold winter, and the cloth is often washed in melted snow water in Kanazawa located in a snowy area.
Unlike the steps of dyeing, it is generally performed in cold winter, and the cloth is often washed in melted snow water in Kanazawa located in a snowy area.

sen.j: 川の上に色とりどりの布が泳ぐさまは観光の目玉にもなる美しさだ。
sen.e: The scene of colorful clothes swimming in the river is so beautiful as to become a key element of sightseeing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The scene of colorful clothes swimming in the river is so beautiful as to become a key element of sightseeing.
The scene of colorful clothes swimming in the river is so beautiful as to become a key element of sightseeing.

sen.j: しかし現在は河川の汚れなどもあり、ほとんどが専門業者の人工の川（施設）で行われている。
sen.e: However, due to the water pollution and the like, it is now performed in artificial rivers (facilities) of professional corporations in most cases.

sen.e: However, due to the water pollution and the like, it is now performed in artificial rivers (facilities) of professional corporations in most cases.

sen.j: 花や葉の模様の輪郭から中心に向かって色をぼかすのが加賀風、その逆が京都風と言われたことも過去にはあったが、現在は模様の区別化のため産地や業者によって特徴づけがなされる程度で明確な決まりは無い。
sen.e: It was said in the past that grading colors from the contours of a flower or a leaf to the center was Kaga style and that the opposite type was Kyoto style, but now there is no clear rule except characterization is made with respect to each production area or each production company for differentiation of the patterns.

sen.j: 図案によっては、こうした模様付けや地色染めが数回繰り返される場合もあり、最後に花の中心部分や動物の目、鳥の羽の模様、昆虫の触角などの細かい部分を墨や顔料で仕上げ、金泥、箔、刺繍などで加飾する場合もある。
sen.e: The pattern dyeing and the base dyeing may be repeated for several times depending on the design, and sometimes minute sections such as the center of a flower, an eye of an animal, a pattern of wings of a bird, and an antenna of an insect may be finished with black ink or pigments and additionally decorated with kindei (gold paint), foil, or embroidery at last.

The pattern dyeing and the base dyeing may be repeated several times depending on the design, and sometimes minute sections such as the center of a flower, the eye of an animal, a pattern of wings of a bird or an antenna of an insect may be finished with black ink or pigments and additionally decorated with kindei (gold paint), foil, or embroidery at the end.

sen.j: 簡単にまとめただけでもこれだけの工程を踏んで友禅が完成する。
sen.e: Yuzen is finished with so many steps as described above, though simply summarized.
Yuzen is finished with so many steps as described above, though simply summarized.
Yuzen is finished with so many steps as described above, though simply summarized.

sen.j: ある程度量産できる型染め友禅でも、必要とする色毎に何枚もの型紙を使い分けていく手間がかかる。
sen.e: Even the yuzen dyeing with models capable of producing a certain amount requires time and effort to use many model papers with respect to each color to be used.
Even the yuzen dyeing with patterns capable of producing a certain amount requires time and effort to use many pattern papers for each color to be used.
Even the yuzen dyeing with patterns capable of producing a certain amount requires time and effort to use many pattern papers for each color to be used.

sen.j: また型染め友禅で複雑な模様は数十枚の型紙を使うこともある。
sen.e: A complicated pattern of yuzen dyeing with models may require tens of the pattern papers.
A complicated pattern of yuzen dyeing with models may require tens of the pattern papers.
A complicated pattern of yuzen dyeing with models may require tens of the pattern papers.

sen.j: 日本では出来上がった着物は母から娘へと引き継がれていく一種の財産とみなされていた。
sen.e: In Japan, a finished kimono was regarded as a kind of property taken over from a mother to a daughter.
In Japan, a finished kimono was regarded as a kind of property taken over from a mother to a daughter.
In Japan, a finished kimono was regarded as a kind of property taken over from a mother to a daughter.

sen.j: 現在でも京都の一部では、嫁入りの際に花嫁が近所の人に嫁入り道具として持参した着物を披露する習慣が残っている。
sen.e: Even in the present day, in a part of Kyoto, there remains a custom that a bride exhibits her kimonos brought as bride's household articles to her neighbors at the time of marriage.
Even in the present day, in part of Kyoto there remains a custom that a bride exhibits her kimonos brought as bride's household articles to her neighbors at the time of marriage.
Even in the present day, in part of Kyoto there remains a custom that a bride exhibits her kimonos brought as bride's household articles to her neighbors at the time of marriage.

tit.j: 京友禅・加賀友禅の違い

sen.j: 日本を代表する二つの文化都市ではぐくまれた友禅染は、それぞれ長い時代の間に風土に合わせて独自の表現を身に着けてきた。
sen.e: Each of the yuzen-zome nurtured by two of the representative cultural cities in Japan acquired a unique expression adapted to the climate over a long time.
Each of the yuzen-zome nurtured by two of the representative cultural cities in Japan acquired a unique expression adapted to the climate over a long time.
Each of the yuzen-zome nurtured by two of the representative cultural cities in Japan acquired a unique expression adapted to the climate over a long time.

sen.j: 現在二つの間には互いに交流があり相違点は小さくなっている。
sen.e: Now, there is a communication between them, and the difference is becoming smaller.
Now there is communication between them, and the difference is becoming smaller.
Now there is communication between them, and the difference is becoming smaller.

sen.j: 色彩
sen.e: Colors
Colors
Colors

sen.j: 京都の友禅は柔らかい色調を好み、何色が基調になっているのか判別しにくいほどの多彩な色を使っていながら、配色に神経が使われ上品で華やかである。
sen.e: Yuzen in Kyoto is fond of soft tone of colors, and it is elegant and gorgeous paying attention to coloration while using so many colors as to making it difficult to determine what color is the basic tone.
Yuzen in Kyoto is fond of soft colors, and it is elegant and gorgeous paying attention to coloration while using so many colors as to make it difficult to determine what color is the basic tone.
Yuzen in Kyoto is fond of soft colors, and it is elegant and gorgeous paying attention to coloration while using so many colors as to make it difficult to determine what color is the basic tone.

sen.j: 加賀友禅も多色を用いるが、加賀五彩（臙脂、黄土、古代紫、草緑、藍）特に紅色や紫、緑などの深みがあって豪奢な色調が基調となり、優雅で艶やか。
sen.e: Kaga-Yuzen also uses many colors, but it is graceful and glamorous based on Kaga-gosai (five colors of Kaga; crimson, odo (yellow ocher), kodai murasaki (ancient purple), grass green, and indigo), especially deep and luxurious tones such as crimson, purple, and green.

Kaga-Yuzen also uses many colors, but it is graceful and glamorous based on Kaga-gosai (five colors of Kaga: crimson, yellow ocher, ancient purple, grass green, and indigo), especially deep and luxurious tones such as crimson, purple, and green.

Kaga-Yuzen also uses many colors, but it is graceful and glamorous based on Kaga-gosai (five colors of Kaga: crimson, yellow ocher, ancient purple, grass green, and indigo), especially deep and luxurious tones such as crimson, purple, and green.

sen.j: 文様
sen.e: Patterns
Patterns
Patterns

sen.j: 古風な有職模様や琳派模様など高度に様式化された文様を得意とする。
sen.e: Highly formalized patterns such as yusoku-moyo (patterns used by scholars in Heian Period) and rinpa-moyo (patterns created by a group of Korin OGATA) are popular.
Highly formalized patterns such as yusoku-moyo (patterns used by scholars in Heian Period) and rinpa-moyo (patterns created by a group of Korin OGATA) are popular.
Highly formalized patterns such as yusoku-moyo (patterns used by scholars in Heian Period) and rinpa-moyo (patterns created by a group of Korin OGATA) are popular.

sen.j: また、刺繍や金箔などを効果的に使った装飾を積極的に併用する。
sen.e: Decorations effectively utilizing embroidery and gold foil are actively employed.
Decorations effectively utilizing embroidery and gold foil are actively employed.
Decorations effectively utilizing embroidery and gold foil are actively employed.

sen.j: 有名な「虫食い」などに代表される写実的な表現を得意とする。
sen.e: A true-to-life expression represented by the famous 'bug-eaten' is also popular.
A true-to-life expression represented by the famous 'bug-eaten' is also popular.
A true-to-life expression represented by the famous 'bug-eaten' is also popular.

sen.j: ほかの技法との併用はほとんどない。
sen.e: A combination with other techniques is hardly seen.
A combination with other techniques is hardly seen.
A combination with other techniques is hardly seen.

sen.j: 友禅染の色彩豊かな彩色方法を考案したのは京都出身の扇絵師、宮崎友禅斎だが、糊置き防染の技法自体はそのころすでに一応の完成を見ていた。
sen.e: Yuzensai MIYAZAKI, the painter of folding fan from Kyoto, invented the coloring method of the colorful yuzen-zome, but the resisting technique using resist paste was already completed at the time.
Yuzensai MIYAZAKI, the folding fan painter from Kyoto, invented the coloring method of the colorful yuzen-zome, but the resisting technique using resist paste was already completed at the time.

sen.j: 友禅に近い技法を使うものに茶屋染と、筒描きがある。
sen.e: Chaya-zome and tsutsugaki use techniques similar to yuzen.
Chaya-zome and tsutsugaki use techniques similar to yuzen.
Chaya-zome and tsutsugaki use techniques similar to yuzen.

sen.j: 茶屋染めは大奥に住まう高位の女性たちの夏の衣装に染められたものであった。
sen.e: Chaya-zome was dyed for summer costumes for high-ranked women living in O-oku (the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chaya-zome was dyed for summer costumes for high-ranked women living in O-oku (the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside).
Chaya-zome was dyed for summer costumes for high-ranked women living in O-oku (the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside).

sen.j: 上等な苧麻布の裏表に糊を置いて白くなる部分を残してから藍で染めたもので、美しく繊細であったが使える色数が限られていた。
sen.e: Paste was applied to both sides of a luxurious choma cloth (a grass cloth) to dye the cloth with indigo leaving white patterns, and, though it was beautiful and delicate, the number of available colors were limited.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Paste was applied to both sides of a luxurious choma cloth (a grass cloth) to dye it with indigo leaving white patterns, and, though it was beautiful and delicate, the number of available colors was limited.

Paste was applied to both sides of a luxurious choma cloth (a grass cloth) to dye it with indigo leaving white patterns, and, though it was beautiful and delicate, the number of available colors was limited.

sen.j: 筒描きは庶民の染物によく使われ、現在でも暖簾や半被、風呂敷などに残る。
sen.e: Tsutsugaki was widely used for dyed goods for general people, which is still seen in noren (a short (split) curtain hung at the entrance of a room), a happi coat (a workman's livery coat), and furoshiki (wrapping cloth).

Tsutsugaki was widely used for dyed goods for ordinary people, which is still seen in noren (a short, split curtain hung at the entrance of a room), happi coats (a workman's livery coat), and furoshiki (wrapping cloth).

Tsutsugaki was widely used for dyed goods for ordinary people, which is still seen in noren (a short, split curtain hung at the entrance of a room), happi coats (a workman's livery coat), and furoshiki (wrapping cloth).

sen.j: 木綿の布の表面だけに筒に入れた糊をたらして模様を白く残したもので、豪快で素朴な持ち味があるもの。
sen.e: It is a technique of applying paste in a cylinder only on the top surface of a cotton cloth to leave a pattern white, which presents a bold and earthy taste.
It is a technique of applying paste in a cylinder only on the top surface of a cotton cloth to leave a pattern in white, which presents a bold and earthy taste.
It is a technique of applying paste in a cylinder only on the top surface of a cotton cloth to leave a pattern in white, which presents a bold and earthy taste.

sen.j: そのほか「型友禅」のような型置き防染では、琉球王朝で生まれた紅型染が有名。
sen.e: In addition to the above, as a resist dyeing using a model like 'kata-yuzen,' bingata-zome emerged in The Ryukyu Kingdom is well known.
In addition to the above, as a resist dyeing using a model like 'kata-yuzen,' bingata-zome emerged in The Ryukyu Kingdom is well known.
In addition to the above, as a resist dyeing using a model like 'kata-yuzen,' bingata-zome emerged in the Ryukyu Kingdom is well known.

sen.j: これは高度な型染め技術を用いて一つの型紙で黄色や赤、緑などの多色使いの鮮やかな文様を描く染物で、本土でも袋物などの生地として珍重されるなど人気を博した。
sen.e: It is a dyeing technique of drawing a colorful pattern with multiple colors such as yellow, red, and green using a single model paper by an advanced technology of dyeing with models, and it became so popular in the mainland that it was used to make pouches and the like.

It is a dyeing technique of drawing a colorful pattern with multiple colors such as yellow, red, and green using a single pattern paper by an advanced technique of dyeing with patterns, and it became so popular in the mainland that it was used to make pouches and the like.

It is a dyeing technique of drawing a colorful pattern with multiple colors such as yellow, red, and green using a single pattern paper by an advanced technique of dyeing with patterns, and it became so popular in the mainland that it was used to make pouches and the like.

sen.j: 元々は琉球固有の植物や中国風の模様が主流だったが、本土向けの輸出が進むにつれて友禅染の文様を取り入れた紅型が増えていき、友禅も紅型に使われる鮮やかな色彩を取り入れていく。
sen.e: Originally, patterns of Ryukyuan native plants and Chinese patterns were mainly used, but bingata taking in the yuzen patterns increased as the export to the mainland increased, and yuzen also took in the vivid colors used in bingata.

Originally, patterns of Ryukyuan native plants and Chinese patterns were mainly used, but bingata taking in the yuzen patterns increased as the export to the mainland increased, and yuzen also took in the vivid colors used in bingata.

Originally, patterns of Ryukyuan native plants and Chinese patterns were mainly used, but bingata taking in the yuzen patterns increased as the export to the mainland increased, and yuzen also took in the vivid colors used in bingata.

sen.j: 現在では、型染め友禅と区別がつきにくい作品もしばしば見られる。
sen.e: Today, there are many of bingata works difficult to be distinguished from the yuzen dyeing with models.
Today, there are many bingata works that are difficult to distinguish from yuzen dyeing with patterns.
Today, there are many bingata works that are difficult to distinguish from yuzen dyeing with patterns.

sen.j: 江戸小紋の技法に「型友禅」の技術を応用して、独特の趣向を打ち出したものが京小紋である。
sen.e: A technique of Edo-komon (fine patterns used in Edo) applied with the technique of 'kata-yuzen' to project a unique taste is Kyo-komon (fine patterns used in Kyoto).
A technique of Edo-komon (fine patterns used in Edo) applied with the technique of 'kata-yuzen' to project a unique taste is Kyo-komon (fine patterns used in Kyoto).
A technique of Edo-komon (fine patterns used in Edo) applied with the technique of 'kata-yuzen' to project a unique taste is Kyo-komon (fine patterns used in Kyoto).

sen.j: 武士が好んだ細かな幾何学模様で簡素で粋な印象の江戸小紋とは違い、友禅模様を基本にした色鮮やかで伸びやかな印象が持ち味である。
sen.e: Unlike Edo-komon with a simple and stylish impression using fine geometrical patterns preferred by samurai, the feature of Kyo-komon is a colorful and free impression based on the yuzen patterns.
Unlike Edo-komon with a simple and stylish impression using fine geometrical patterns preferred by samurai, the feature of Kyo-komon is a colorful and free impression based on the yuzen patterns.
Unlike Edo-komon with a simple and stylish impression using fine geometrical patterns preferred by samurai, the feature of Kyo-komon is a colorful and free impression based on the yuzen patterns.

sen.j: 糊置き防染の技法を用いず、直接白生地に絵筆にて絵柄を施す染色法として「描上友禅（かきあげゆうぜん）」がある。
sen.e: There is 'kakiage-yuzen,' which is a dyeing technique of drawing a pattern directly on a white cloth with a brush without using the resisting technique using the resist paste.
There is 'kakiage-yuzen,' which is a dyeing technique of drawing a pattern directly on a white cloth with a brush without using the resisting technique.
There is 'kakiage-yuzen,' which is a dyeing technique of drawing a pattern directly on a white cloth with a brush without using the resisting technique.

sen.j: 防染処理を施さないため、色滲みが避けられず迅速な筆捌きを要求される高度な技法である。
sen.e: It is a highly-skilled technique requiring a quick brush strokes because running of colors is inevitable as the resisting process is not performed.
It is a highly-skilled technique requiring quick brush strokes because running of colors is inevitable as the resisting process is not performed.
It is a highly-skilled technique requiring quick brush strokes because running of colors is inevitable as the resisting process is not performed.

sen.j: 絵柄的には通常の友禅染めに比べて簡潔単純なものにならざるを得ないが、優れた作品にはのびやかで自由大胆な構図のものが多い。
sen.e: The pattern must be simpler compared with common yuzen dyeing, but excellent works often use a free and bold composition.
The pattern must be simpler compared with common yuzen dyeing, but excellent works often use a free and bold composition.
The pattern must be simpler compared with common yuzen dyeing, but excellent works often use a free and bold composition.

sen.j: 作家個人の技量は勿論であるが、確かな全体構成を基に、細部に拘わらず一気に「描き上げる」ための、強靱かつ自由な精神性がより強く要求される。
sen.e: As well as the individual skill of the artist, a strong and free spiritual nature for 'painting off' in a breath without regard to details based on an absolute total composition is required more.
As well as the individual skill of the artist, a strong and free spiritual nature for 'painting off' in a breath without regard to details based on an absolute total composition is required more.
As well as the individual skill of the artist, a strong and free spiritual nature for 'painting off' in a breath without regard to details based on an absolute total composition is required more.

sen.j: 現代染色作家の中でもこの技法を使える人は十指に満たぬ程度と言われている。
sen.e: It is said that only a few of present dyeing artists can use this technique.
It is said that only a few of dyers today can use this technique.
It is said that only a few of dyers today can use this technique.

sen.j: 東京を産地とする、伝統的工芸品。
sen.e: A traditional handcraft produced in Tokyo.
A traditional handcraft produced in Tokyo.
A traditional handcraft produced in Tokyo.

sen.j: 東京手描友禅や江戸友禅とも言われる。
sen.e: It is also referred to as Tokyo hand-drawn yuzen and Edo-yuzen.
It is also referred to as Tokyo hand-drawn yuzen and Edo-yuzen.
It is also referred to as Tokyo hand-drawn yuzen and Edo-yuzen.

sen.j: 東京友禅の特徴は、江戸の街の町人文化を背景とした、渋く落ち着いた色合いの中にも、都会的センスの洒落感が漂う作風が特徴とされる。
sen.e: Tokyo-yuzen is characterized in a style with an urban chic in subdued and soft shades against a background of the townsmen culture in Edo.
Tokyo-yuzen is characterized by an urban chic style in subdued and soft shades against a background of the townsmen culture in Edo.
